intro: Tabernaemontana rigida, commonly known as the rigid star of Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its striking, funnel-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of white, pink, and red. The plant produces a milky sap that contains toxic compounds, which can be harmful if ingested. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its unique appearance and seasonal blooming make it a notable species in botanical gardens and native plant collections.
